questions.question_text:
SIMULATION
-

You need to ensure that when users join meeting by using a phone, they are prompted to record their name.

To complete this task, sign in to the Microsoft 365 portal.

comments.content: The option is available under both meeting policies and new meeting settings (global meeting policy + meeting settings)
Agreed, this should be under Meeting Policies!

discussion.content: Step 1 is wrong. The option to let users anonymously join a meeting is located in Meeting Settings and not in Meeting Policies.

questions.question_text:
SIMULATION
-

You need to prevent unauthenticated users from joining Teams meetings.

To complete this task, sign in to the Microsoft 365 portal.

discussion.content:
1. Set Record and transcribe in Teams Meeting: TAC > Meetings > Meeting Policies > click Global (Org-wide default) > Meeting recording: On, Transcription: On.
2. Set Record and transcribe in Teams Calls: TAC > Voice > Calling Policies > click Global (Org-wide default) > Cloud recording for calling: On, Transcription: On.

questions.question_text:
SIMULATION
-

You need to prevent guest users from calling your company’s Teams users.

To complete this task, sign in to the Microsoft 365 portal.

Your company has a Microsoft 365 subscription.

A user invites an external user to join a Microsoft Teams meeting by using a Microsoft Outlook meeting invitation.

The external user cannot join the meeting.

You need to ensure that all external users can join Microsoft Team meetings.

What should you do from the Microsoft Teams admin center?

choices.B: Edit the Meeting settings and set Anonymous users can join a meeting to On.
choices.A: From Guest access, set Allow guest access in Teams to On.
choices.C: Edit the global meeting policy and set Private meeting scheduling to On.
choices.D: Edit the live events policy and set Who can join scheduled live events to Everyone.

comments.content:
Nop, the question is abount EXTERNAL and not GUEST.

The answer is B: Allow anonymous join to meetings.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Guest Access to Teams is enabled in the Guest Settings. 

The Meeting Settings tab does not have Guest options in it.
The question is about Teams meetings, Private chats are not mentioned
The question does not mention a live event

Selected Answer: B
B is the answer.
